listitem.para: whether pluto should use hardware acceleration for cryptographic operations. Valid values are: never, ipsec, pk, and (the default) available.

If pluto finds the Open Cryptographic Framework installed, it can offload public key operations to hardware. If KLIPS finds hardware installed, it can offload symmetric operations. The default is to use the hardware if available.

The setting never causes pluto to not use any hardware. The setting pk causes pluto to only use acceleration for Public Key operations (but not for symmetric operations for IPsec SAs). The setting ipsec causes pluto to not use the hardware for public key operations, but to use it for IPsec SAs if possible.
As of this writing it is not possible to disable using the hardware acceleration for IPsec operations directly from pluto. If the hardware is there, it will be used.
